sg.edu.cs2103aug2015_w13_2j.storage

Interface StorageInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Storage, StorageStub, StorageTest

    public interface StorageInterface

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearDataFile()
      DANGER: Irreversibly clears the FunDUE data file of all contents.
      java.io.File getDataFile()
      Retrieves the File object representing the current FunDUE data file.
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> readTasksFromDataFile()
      Reads the FunDUE data file and returns a list of parsed Task objects.
      void setDataFile(java.io.File dataFile)
      Sets the FunDUE data file to the provided File object and updates the user's data file path preference.
      void writeTasksToDataFile(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
      Writes the provided list of Task objects to the FunDUE data file.

    • Method Detail

      • readTasksFromDataFile

        java.util.ArrayList<Task> readTasksFromDataFile()
        Reads the FunDUE data file and returns a list of parsed Task objects.
        Returns:
        List of Task objects parsed from the FunDUE data file.

      • writeTasksToDataFile

        void writeTasksToDataFile(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
        Writes the provided list of Task objects to the FunDUE data file.
        Parameters:
        tasks - List of Task objects to be written to the FunDUE data file.

      • getDataFile

        java.io.File getDataFile()
        Retrieves the File object representing the current FunDUE data file.
        Returns:
        File object representing the current FunDUE data file.

      • setDataFile

        void setDataFile(java.io.File dataFile)
        Sets the FunDUE data file to the provided File object and updates the user's data file path preference. If the File object points to a non-existent file, the file will be created.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - File object to be used as the new FunDUE data file. If null then this method does nothing.

      • clearDataFile

        void clearDataFile()
        DANGER: Irreversibly clears the FunDUE data file of all contents.
